message_1: In how many ways can a committee of 4 students be chosen from 10 students, if 2 of the students, Adam and Ben are declared ineligible to be part of the committee due to disciplinary reasons?
message_2:
Since Adam and Ben are ineligible, we are left with 8 students to choose from. We need to choose a committee of 4 students from these 8.

The number of ways to do this can be calculated using the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of students to choose from (8 in this case) and k is the number of students to choose (4 in this case).

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!(8-4)!)

C(8, 4) = 8! / (4!4!)

C(8, 4) = (8*7*6*5) / (4*3*2*1)

C(8, 4) = 1680 / 24

C(8, 4) = 70

So, there are 70 ways to choose a committee of 4 students from the remaining 8 students.
